result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M. Bentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

Complete SAFE program intake with follow up.
Complete assessment, counseling, and treatment deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge
Allowed to petition for expungement at age 23 is sucessfully completes probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called: 1:53pm
INCLUDES 15CM396 & 15CM625
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer.
Date and time set for motion to revoke DEOJ

State says here to revoke DEOJ in 15CM396 Ct. 1 (DC-domestic abuse) and 15CM625 Ct. 2 (DC)
COURT grants states motion to revoke DEOJ
COURT enters judgment of conviction in 15CM396 Ct. 1 & 15CM625 Ct. 2
Atty Sawyer makes statement regarding expungement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 1 year probation, concurrent. CONDITONS: Complete SAFE intake program with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. Complete any other assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. Pay CC. Pay one domestic abuse surcharge. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Allowed to petition for expungement on 15CM396 Ct. 1 at age 23 if successfully completes this probation and no new charges filed.

INCLUDES 15CM396, 15CM625, 15CM1147 & 15CM1471
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer

State moves to:

COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CM396
Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct- Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST
15CM625
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST
15CM1471
Ct. 1 Operate w/o valid license (3rd w/in 3 yrs) >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 15CM1471 Ct. 1 pay $5.00 fine plus court costs. Defendent has valid drivers license
COURT ORDERS: 15CM396 Ct. 1 & 15CM625 Ct. 2 - COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
CONDITIONS: complete SAFE program and assessment with any recommendations by agent. No new offenses. Maintain GFE with full time work or full time school, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service. Maintain absolute sobriety. No abusive contact with L.B. and no contact with victim B.H. 
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS 15CM396 Ct. 1 and be charged in 15CM625 Ct. 2 plus pay court costs. 
Parties to set RH date on DEOJ with JA.
Bond continues.

Case called: 10:59am. Clerk: Denise. Dft. Appears prose. Court questions Dft. RE: Employment/Income. Defendant states as of yesterday he does not have employment. Court states Defendant should qualify now and be revaluated. Defendant makes statement about contact with victim.  Crt can not address that. C: Br. 1. Adjourned: 11:01am.

Indigency hearing on March 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 7, 2015 at 02:10 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury Trial on June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): B.H. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
